newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Wal-Mart to invest more than $100 mln in Argentina.
newsitem.headline: Wal-Mart to invest more than $100 mln in Argentina.

text.p: Wal-Mart Stores, the largest U.S. retailer, announced Tuesday it will invest more than $100 million to build four new outlets in Argentina over the next year.
"Wal-Mart super-centers have been a success in Argentina. We are excited at the prospect of reaching new cities," CEO Bob Martin told a news conference.

"Seventy-six million will be invested in buildings and construction. In addition you add equipment and depending on the transactions, the land value and so forth, all of that will be in the $100 million plus range," said Martin.
"That will put our total investment in Argentina (so far) in the range of $300 million," he added.
